item.title: Asian financial institutions are expected to see an average pay increase of 4% in 2016
item.description:
Limits on variable pay are leading to an increase in guaranteed fixed pay. Asia and Latin America are projected to see average base pay increases of 4.3% in 2016, in contrast to 2% to 2.7% in Europe and North America. Overall, 2016 pay is expected to remain stable, with lower variable pay offset by increases in fixed pay. Source: Mercer. Mercer’s 11th annual Global Financial Services Executive Compensation Snapshot Survey reveals that in 2015, financial services companies worldwide continued to react to regulatory changes...

item.title: Credit card applications can now be approved instantly by DBS
item.description:
DBS Bank in Singapore has introduced a new online application service using the national platform, MyInfo. This service allows new and existing customers to apply for credit cards and open DBS Cashline accounts with instant approval and access to funds, making it a first in Singapore. Available to 3.3 million SingPass holders, this service, accessible through DBS/POSB Internet banking and websites, simplifies the application process. Typically, new customers wait up to a week for credit card or DBS Cashline access, but using MyInfo eliminates the need for traditional applications and physical documents, providing real-time approval...

item.title: Financial services companies are placing a greater emphasis on developing a strong risk culture
item.description:
A recent study by Mercer focusing on executive compensation in the global financial services industry found that a majority of firms are prioritizing the development of robust risk cultures within their organizations. Sixty-two percent of surveyed firms reported significant efforts to penalize misconduct and non-compliance, while 60% demonstrated clear leadership commitment to ethical behavior. Furthermore, 58% have established and communicated unambiguous objectives related to risk culture. Vicki Elliott, Senior Partner and Financial Services Talent Leader at Mercer, highlighted the importance of senior leaders setting a positive example when it comes to risk management and compliance...

item.title: Bank Negara Malaysia develops mobile applications for the convenience of consumers
item.description:
The Central Bank of Malaysia, Bank Negara Malaysia, has launched three new mobile applications designed to empower consumers to make well-informed financial decisions. These applications – MyBNM, BNM MyLINK, and MyTabung – aim to keep consumers updated on financial developments, provide tools for financial planning and management, and enable them to exercise their financial rights. MyBNM serves as the official Bank Negara Malaysia mobile application, offering consumers access to the latest financial news...

item.title: Labuan IBFC experienced a 12.3% increase in new company registrations in 2014
item.description:

item.title: Walton encourages financial literacy through moderated Cashflow games
item.description:
Playing the Cashflow game was a thrilling experience. I managed to buy and sell a startup within an hour, earning a quick $100,000 profit. With my pilot’s salary, cash flow was excellent. However, other players faced financial struggles, barely making ends meet or lacking funds for investments. I focused on smaller investments initially, cleared some liabilities with guidance from the banker, and increased my spending and income. Although my passive income was slightly less than my expenses, someone else came closer to achieving financial freedom...
